p: When it comes to climate change-related pathologies, emergency physicians, including those outside usual endemic areas, should be prepared to recognize and treat infectious diseases that are considered rare locally. Furthermore, especially when new facilities are built, hospitals and EDs must anticipate an increased rate of visits and admissions [ 57, 63]. ED management must also take into account the increased use of emergency response resources in the event of an exceptional variation in ambient temperature. In addition, social network tools specifically adapted to monitoring and sharing pertinent information regarding these health hazards should be set up at the global level. The emergence of new technologies in climate analysis and flow analysis should also be rapidly integrated into this approach.
